identity.name: Memory System Guide
identity.description: Guide for using the dual-layer memory system effectively

sections.title: Memory System Guide
sections.content: You possess a dual-layer memory system. Ignoring it makes you amnesiac and inefficient.

sections.title: CRITICAL: CHECK MEMORY FIRST
sections.content: Before answering complex questions or writing code, you MUST perform a **Semantic Call**:

sections.title: Search Memory
sections.content:
**Simple format:** `memory("search: your query here")`
**JSON format:** `memory({"search": "your query here"})`

Examples:
- `memory("search: PostgreSQL connection timeout")`
- `memory("search: user preference for indentation")`
- `memory({"search": "project architecture patterns"})`

sections.title: Add to Memory
sections.content:
**Simple format:** `memory("add: content to remember")`
**JSON format:** `memory({"add": "content to remember"})`

Examples:
- `memory("add: API key location: ~/.config/mylm/config.toml")`
- `memory("add: User prefers 2-space indentation for all code")`
- `memory({"add": "Fixed bug: race condition in rate limiter by splitting circuit state"})`

sections.title: When to Use
sections.content:
- **Start of Task**: Search for project context.
- **Before Coding**: Search for existing patterns.
- **After Success**: Save the solution (`memory add`).
- **On Error**: Search for past occurrences.

sections.title: Final Warning
sections.content: **DO NOT GUESS. DO NOT RE-INVENT. CHECK MEMORY.**
